column4: hi, i have a drive and it wont automount, but if i mount it manually i can't get persmissions to view it, help ?
have you tried the diskmounter applet?
nope, never heard of it, where do i find it ?
right-click the gnome-panel..add applet.. and select disk mounter
but i can mount it with terminal
hmm... try appending the umask option to your mount options? that might help
if i use dmesg the system sees the drive being attached, but just wont read it properly
and nothing? what filesystem type is it?
hmm... can you do a filesystem check?
fsck.vfat i think is the command you want.. man fsck.vfat for more options
